properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 4 at 2:46PM CST until February 6 at 6:00AM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation
expected, mostly snow and sleet. Total snow accumulations of 1
to 3 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an
inch. For the Winter Weather Advisory tonight, light freezing
rain expected with a light glaze of ice possible. Winds gusting
as high as 25 mph.

* WHERE...Portions of east central Missouri and south central
and southwest Illinois.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 9 AM Wednesday to 6
AM CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM
this evening to midnight CST tonight.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions will impact the evening commute on Wednesday.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet
and/or ice are expected to occur. If travel is necessary, make
sure to exercise extreme caution. Begin your travel with a full
tank of gas, and carry a winter storm kit which includes a shovel,
flashlight, cellphone, food and water, and blankets of extra warm
clothing.

A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of freezing rain or
freezing drizzle will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for
slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving.

In Illinois, the latest road conditions can be obtained on the
Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Missouri, the
latest road conditions can be obtained on the Internet at
traveler.modot.org/map/ or by calling 1-888-275-6636.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY
HazardType: Heavy Mixed precipitation, Freezing Rain, Mixed Precipitation
